q: Hampshire's Granite State Poll, said it's not surprising that activists are urging Mike Pence to run. But, he noted, that doesn't mean he has a good chance of winning. Republicans and Democrats go through this all the time, Andrew P. Smith said.`` Particularly party activists don't see a candidate who is either well enough known, or ideologically or intellectually consistent enough for them, so they try to recruit people who fit the bill.

Times begins its story with Donald Rumsfeld 's account about being told by George W. Bush two weeks after the 9/11 attacks, to prepare review the Pentagon's plans for a war with Iraq. According to the Times: Two weeks after the worst terrorist attack in our nation's history, those of us in the Department of Defense were fully occupied, Mr. Donald Rumsfeld recalls. But the George W. Bush insisted on new military plans for Iraq, Mr. Donald Rumsfeld writes.`` He wanted the options to be` creative.''' For more than two decades, NPR

well, it says pretty much everything you'd expect Donald Rumsfeld 's book to say. There is this, though: As for declaring, as he did in the first weeks after the invasion of Iraq, We know where they are, referring to suspected stockpiles of weapons of mass destruction- well, Donald Rumsfeld would like to take that one back, too.
